results.title: Chronic blockade of angiotensin II action prevents glomerulosclerosis, but induces graft vasculopathy in experimental kidney transplantation.
results.text_hl: This study examines the long-term (34 weeks) effects of the @GENE_ACE @GENE_24310 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and the angiotensin II receptor type I blocker @CHEMICAL_L_158809 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C070967 @@@L158,809@@@ in the Fisher to Lewis @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model of @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@chronic renal transplant failure@@@.

results.title: Drug therapy for hypertension in hemodialysis patients.
results.text_hl: Nonselective beta-blockers can cause an increase in serum @CHEMICAL_Potassium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011188 @@@potassium@@@ (particularly during fasting or exercise). @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ have a predominant renal excretion and therefore a prolonged half life in @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@ESRD@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Hörl MP, Hörl WH. Drug therapy for hypertension in hemodialysis patients. Semin Dial. 2004 Jul-Aug;17(4):288-94. PMID: 15250920
citations.BibTeX: @article{15250920, title={Drug therapy for hypertension in hemodialysis patients.}, author={Hörl MP and Hörl WH}, journal={Semin Dial}, volume={17}, number={4}, pages={288-94}}

results.title: Dual renin-angiotensin system blockade for nephroprotection: still under scrutiny.
results.text_hl: The VA NEPHRON D study found that @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ combination therapy reduced by 34% the risk of predefined reductions in estimated glomerular filtration rate, @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@ESRD@@@ or @DISEASE_Death @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ as compared to @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ in 1,448 @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with overt @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@nephropathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Gentile G, Remuzzi G, Ruggenenti P. Dual renin-angiotensin system blockade for nephroprotection: still under scrutiny. Nephron. 2015;129(1):39-41. PMID: 25531311
citations.BibTeX: @article{25531311, title={Dual renin-angiotensin system blockade for nephroprotection: still under scrutiny.}, author={Gentile G and Remuzzi G and Ruggenenti P}, journal={Nephron}, volume={129}, number={1}, pages={39-41}}

results.title: Dual renin-angiotensin system blockade for nephroprotection.
results.text_hl: However, the VA NEPHRON D study found that @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ combination therapy reduced by 34 % the risk of pre-defined reductions in estimated glomerular filtration rate, @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@end-stage renal disease@@@ or @DISEASE_Death @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ as compared to @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ in 1448 @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with overt @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@nephropathy@@@.
